Key Match Events: Chet Holmgren suffered a right hip injury in Sunday's 127-116 defeat against the Golden State Warriors after a collision in the air and landing forcefully on his right side.
Post-Match Reflections: Thunder coach Mark Daigneault stated after the game that he had no updates on Holmgren's injury or his potential recovery time.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed concern for Holmgren's injury, saying 'It's tough to see. Hopefully, he's okay.'
Jalen Williams stated that if Holmgren has to be absent for an extended period, the team will know how to adapt.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Without Holmgren, who was the second overall pick in the 2022 draft, the Thunder were forced to use smaller lineups against the Warriors.
Backup center Isaiah Hartenstein is also out of action at the start of the season due to a small non-displaced fracture in his left hand.
The Thunder now hold an 8-2 record after the loss.
